About Us

We're revolutionzing commercial real estate through innovation.

VTS delivers a powerful, intuitive solution made by and for real estate professionals. We were founded with a vision to revolutionize the industry by genuinely understanding its business and workflow challenges. We live and breathe this version every day. Our customers' success is our success.

What is VTS?
We come to work every day and ask ourselves â€˜How can we make the the day-to-day work life of our users better?â€™ This is the DNA of our company and it always will be.
Nick Romito, CEO & Co-Founder

Meet our leadership team.

Ryan Masiello

CRO and Co-Founder

Ryan Masiello is the co-founder and Chief Revenue Officer of VTS. He brings more than 12 years of experience in Midtown Manhattan commercial real estateâ€“ the worldâ€™s most competitive office marketâ€” to the table and is charged with leading VTSâ€™ international expansion. Ryan started his career at Cushman & Wakefield, before getting recruited by JLL to help lead the firmâ€™s business development efforts in New York. During his seven years at JLL, Ryan became Senior Vice President and brokered over 2 million square feet of office deals with Fortune 500 and high-growth technology companies, earning him honors as a four-time global top-producer. Ryan frequently advised on corporate technology and growth strategies for JLL.

Ryan has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, Entrepreneur Magazine and the Commercial Observer. When heâ€™s not in the office, he can be found surfing, skateboarding, snowboarding and exploring the world.

Nick Romito
CEO & Co-Founder

Nick Romito is the co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of VTS. Nick started his career in commercial real estate over a decade ago as a tenant rep and landlord broker at New York Cityâ€™s Murray Hill Properties. There, he expanded the U.S. presence of international companies while supporting the growth of the firmâ€™s 8-million square-foot office portfolio. Nick went on to AM Properties, where he oversaw a 3-million square-foot office portfolio, before becoming the founder and CEO of Titan Advisors in 2009. While leading Titan, a full-service commercial real estate firm, Nick realized the need in the industry for a technology platform that could centralize leasing activity, analytics, and marketing.

Nick has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, and Entrepreneur Magazine. He has spoken at Harvard Business Schoolâ€™s Technology Cyberposium and the Empire Startups NY FinTech Conference. Nick is a self-professed outdoor enthusiast and has earned several national awards in surfing.

Ryan has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, Entrepreneur Magazine and the Commercial Observer. When heâ€™s not in the office, he can be found surfing, skateboarding, snowboarding and exploring the world.
Brandon Weber
CPO & Co-Founder

Brandon Weber is the co-founder and Chief Product Officer at VTS. Before joining VTS, Brandon Weber was a co-founder and CEO of Hightowerâ€”the only CRE leasing and asset management software that shared the vision of VTS. In November 2016, VTS and Hightower decided that a truly unified solution for the industry would come from the companies joining forces.

Before Hightower and VTS, Brandon was a First Vice President at CBRE, where he managed the leasing strategy for over 4 million square feet of institutionally owned office/biotech assets. Brandon began his career in software product development, first as a Program Manager at Microsoft developing Excel, and later at Zillow as a Senior Program Manager. He received two degrees in computer science from Carnegie Mellon and holds five patents in software design.

Brandon has been featured in Forbes, The Wall Street Journal and The Real Deal. When heâ€™s not building VTS, Brandon can be found exploring his other passions of skiing, hiking and endurance running.
Michelle McComb
CFO

Michelle McComb is the Chief Financial Officer at VTS, bringing proven financial and operational experience in scaling high growth companies to the role. Michelleâ€™s career has spanned a wide range of industries and roles. Prior to joining VTS, Michelle was the CFO of Datto, covering a wide range of responsibilities beyond Finance and/Accounting, the CFO of Bloomberg's Financial Products division, a Managing Director at UBS Investment Bank, International CFO at Lucent Technologies and CFO of VitalSigns Software.

McComb began her career at Ernst & Young in Silicon Valley. She holds Bachelor of Science in Accounting. and Masters in Professional Accounting degrees from Weber State University and is a CPA licensed in the State of CA. Outside of VTS, Michelle is an avid horse-rider.
Tim Harvey
Executive Chairman

Tim Harvey is the Executive Chairman of VTS. He brings extensive experience guiding high-growth companies that offer software and services across a variety of industries. Most recently, Tim served as President of Commercial Solutions at BAE Systems Plc (LON:BA), a leading global defense, aerospace and security company. Tim joined BAE as a result of the acquisition of SilverSky in October 2014, a provider of security software and managed services where as CEO he was responsible for the growth and sale of the business to BAE. Tim graduated with a degree in Finance from the University of Florida and served 4 years as an officer in the United States Marine Corps.
Niall Smart
SVP of Engineering & Co-Founder

Niall Smart is the co-founder and SVP Engineering at VTS. Previously, he was the co-founder and CTO at Hightower. Niallâ€™s career in technology spans enterprise solutions, digital media and embedded devices. He loves to work with cross-discipline product teams applying their creativity, skill and energy to build industry-changing products.

Previously to VTS and Hightower, Niall was co-founder of Echodio, a Y-Combinator backed digital media startup that was acquired by RealNetworks in 2009. At RealNetworks he led development of cloud media initiatives and launched their first web-based video product. Niall originally hails from Dublin, Ireland and holds a degree in Computer Science from Imperial College London. At weekends, you can find Niall cycling up inclines in Rockland County, or checking out New Yorkâ€™s live music scene.
Andrew Rains
SVP of Sales

Andrew Rains is the SVP of Sales at VTS. Andrew has proven experience leading high-performing teams and delivering strong growth for technology companies. Prior to VTS, Andrew was Chief Revenue Officer at The Rainmaker, and SVP at Intuit. He also has 10 years of experience in commercial real estate, with seven of these years spent at CBRE. Andrew holds a finance degree from Baylor University. He has been featured in the Wall Street Journal and CNN. When he's not at the office, Andrew enjoys a good game of table tennis, playing golf and hiking.
Angela Kuo
SVP of People

Angela Kuo is the SVP of People at VTS. She is a seasoned executive having worked in several high-growth, entrepreneurial environments building and scaling organizations related to all facets of the People function. She has held People leadership roles at FanDuel, SecondMarket and TheLadders where she was an essential recruitment and people leader across multiple business units in high growth, startup environments.

Over a 20+ year career, she has helped lead organizations through growth, all while focusing on making those organizations amazing places to work where people can develop and be themselves. She is skilled in building and nurturing relationships, individuals, and teams, creating environments that drive employee engagement and support professional growth.

Angela grew up in New Jersey and Florida. She went to college and grad school at Ohio Dominican University in Columbus, Ohio. She currently lives in Westchester with her husband and three boys.
Patrick Kehoe
SVP of Customer Success & Services

Patrick Kehoe is responsible for Customer Success & Services at VTS. Prior to VTS, Patrick spent three years at Hightower as SVP of Commercial Operations leading Customer Success, Operations and Marketing and helping the company scale 100% year on year over that period. Prior to Hightower, Patrick spent six years at McKinsey & Company as an Associate Principal in the Technology practice advising executive teams on how to better scale their businesses and optimize the sales, marketing and operations.

Patrick lives in Manhattan with his wife and three energetic kids. Outside of work, Patrick is a keen poker and chess player and an avid swimmer. Patrick holds and MBA from the Wharton School of Business, an M.S. in Engineering from University of Southern California and a B.E. in Electrical Engineering from University College Dublin.
